text.p: Cleanup continues along the Red River in the upper Plains of the USA and in southern Manitoba, Canada, near Winnepeg. One period of light rain has ended. Another may arrive on Saturday. Rainfall will not likely be heavy enough to aggrivate flooding.

Tropical Storm Kelly, with 45 mph winds, is near 11.9n/166.8e, north of the Marshall Islands in the western Pacific, moving north northwest at 4 mph. Kelly will continue to weaken and will likely be dissipated by 48 hours. The threat to shipping and to islands in Micronesia will diminish with time.
There are no further statements at this time.
